item.title: The struggle is real
item.dc:creator: frodriguez
item.description: Back in the day, I was the editor of my College newspaper, The University Daily — it was called. Because students in the 1960s were pushing for Texas Technological College to become a university, they changed the paper’s name to drop in some magic potion in the zeitgeist. As editor, I had pages to fill […]

item.title: Old life for a new site?
item.dc:creator: frodriguez
item.description: First time posting anything in a while… actually, saving the post locally and sneaking it into Github?

item.title: Pink, pink pink
item.dc:creator: pacodotorg
item.description: Although my formative years took place in the 1980s, the 90s were a force to be reckoned with, once I started to pay attention. That being said, the close of the decade brought a seal to the era in an unusual way: a commercial on television, featuring a song from the 1970s. There’s many an […]

item.title: The time machine
item.dc:creator: pacodotorg
item.description: I have the habit of not changing the station, or the tape, or the CD, or the playlist that I listen to and I end up listening to the same album for months on end. Whether it be auto search, or song skip or whatever, I burn a song in my head until I get […]

item.title: And then all things changed
item.dc:creator: pacodotorg
item.description: (Somehow rearranged.) And it happened driving somewhere in somebody’s car, that the radio played the M/A/R/R/S mashup “Pump Up the Volume,” and music changed forever, all at once. NOTE TO SELF: “… and then all things changed, somehow rearranged” are the lyrics I remember from the early 1980s HBO show “Remember When.” Dick Cavett hosted […]
